message_def.name: ReportDrawingDefinition
message_def.description: This message is used to provide a Drawing Definition containing one or more Graphic Commands and associated data.

fixed_field.name: DrawingDefinitionReference
fixed_field.interpretation: Unique reference to the Drawing Definition used in the system.

sequence.name: PageSeq
sequence.interpretation: The Page command defines the limits of the coordinate system used by the remote asset for the Graphics Viewport. Operator interfaces shall interpret this definition and adjust the limits such that the actual limits retain a 1:1 ratio with the physical dimensions of the operator interface Graphics Viewport. Any adjustments required to the page command coordinates will retain the center position on the operator interface Graphics Viewport. The page command shall appear first in a Drawing Definition.

declared_variant.name: MinimumX
declared_variant.interpretation: User defined minimum X coordinate of the display frame

declared_variant.name: MinimumY
declared_variant.interpretation: User defined minimum Y coordinate of the display frame

declared_variant.name: MaximumX
declared_variant.interpretation: User defined maximum X coordinate of the display frame

declared_variant.name: MaximumY
declared_variant.interpretation: User defined maximum Y coordinate of the display frame

record.name: BackgroundRec
record.interpretation: The Background command allows the background color of the drawing area to be set. Limited color displays shall suitably convert the RGB value. By default, the background color shall be white RGB (255, 255, 255).

fixed_field.name: RedColor
fixed_field.interpretation: Red value of the background color of drawing area

fixed_field.name: GreenColor
fixed_field.interpretation: Green value of the background color of drawing area

fixed_field.name: BlueColor
fixed_field.interpretation: Blue value of the background color of drawing area

record.name: PenRec
record.interpretation: The Pen command allows the definition of the active pen color for drawing. Limited color displays shall suitably convert the RGB value. By default, the pen color shall be black RGB (0, 0, 0).

fixed_field.name: RedColor
fixed_field.interpretation: Red value of the new pen color

fixed_field.name: GreenColor
fixed_field.interpretation: Green value of the new pen color

fixed_field.name: BlueColor
fixed_field.interpretation: Blue value of the new pen color

record.name: PenWidthRec
record.interpretation: Defines the active drawing pen line width. By default, the pen width shall be 1 pixel.

fixed_field.name: Width
fixed_field.interpretation: Width of drawing pen in pixels

record.name: BrushRec
record.interpretation: The Brush command defines the fill color for drawing filled shapes. Limited color displays shall suitably convert the RGB value. By default, the brush color shall be black RGB (0, 0, 0).

fixed_field.name: RedColor
fixed_field.interpretation: Red value of the new brush color

fixed_field.name: GreenColor
fixed_field.interpretation: Green value of the new brush color

fixed_field.name: BlueColor
fixed_field.interpretation: Blue value of the new brush color

record.name: DigitalControlRec
record.interpretation: The Digital Control command allows the remote asset to define a digital control at a position on the screen. The operator interface defines the size of the digital control determined by guidelines or standards for the application domain. The Drawing Service defines the digital controls outside the Graphics Viewport in four Digital Control Groups. Each Digital Control Group can contain five digital controls.

fixed_field.name: Reference
fixed_field.interpretation: Reference to the digital control used to define the state of the digital control in DCM messages

fixed_field.name: DigitalControlRec
fixed_field.interpretation: Digital Control position within Group. 0 = Top/Left … 4 = Lower/Right

fixed_length_string.name: Label
fixed_length_string.interpretation: The text to label the digital control in a null terminated ASCII String

record.name: DigitalControlGroupRec
record.interpretation: The Digital Control Group command assigns a label to one of the four Digital Control Groups. The Digital Control Group text may be used on displays that cannot display 20 digital controls simultaneously.

fixed_length_string.name: Label
fixed_length_string.interpretation: The text to label the digital control in a null terminated ASCII String

sequence.name: LabelSeq
sequence.interpretation: The Label command allows the remote asset to create output only text onto the display. The text is displayed at the current transform rotation.

declared_variant.name: X
declared_variant.interpretation: X coordinate in User Space

declared_variant.name: Y
declared_variant.interpretation: Y coordinate in User Space

declared_variant.name: Size
declared_variant.interpretation: Font point size (72 points per inch)

variable_length_string.name: Text
variable_length_string.interpretation: Text of label in a null terminated ASCII String

sequence.name: ValueSeq
sequence.interpretation: The Value command allows the remote asset to display a variable value on the operator interface Graphics Viewport. The variable Reference defines the text displayed.

declared_variant.name: X
declared_variant.interpretation: X coordinate in User Space

declared_variant.name: Y
declared_variant.interpretation: Y coordinate in User Space

declared_variant.name: Size
declared_variant.interpretation: Font point size (72 points per inch)

declared_variant.name: DataReference
declared_variant.interpretation: Text of label in a null terminated ASCII String

sequence.name: RotateSeq
sequence.interpretation: The Rotate command defines an angular rotation of the graphics transformation matrix. Positive angles are a clockwise rotation. By default, the rotation angle shall be 0 micro-radians from the horizontal.

declared_variant.name: Angle
declared_variant.interpretation: The angular rotation in micro-radians

sequence.name: AntiRotateSeq
sequence.interpretation: The Anti-rotate command defines a rotation in an anti-clockwise direction, to complement the ‘Rotate’ command above.

declared_variant.name: Angle
declared_variant.interpretation: The negative angular rotation in micro-radians

sequence.name: TranslateSeq
sequence.interpretation: The Translate command defines a positional shift of the graphics transformation matrix. By default, the translation shall be (0, 0) from the origin.

declared_variant.name: TX
declared_variant.interpretation: The X transformation in User Space

declared_variant.name: TY
declared_variant.interpretation: The Y transformation in User Space

sequence.name: AntiTranslateSeq
sequence.interpretation: The Anti-translate command defines a positional shift in the opposite direction to the Translate command above. This allows the same variable references to be used to obtain an opposite action to a translate command.

declared_variant.name: TX
declared_variant.interpretation: The negative X transformation in User Space

declared_variant.name: TY
declared_variant.interpretation: The negative Y transformation in User Space

sequence.name: RectangleSeq
sequence.interpretation: The Rectangle command specifies a box drawing. X, Y defines the lower left corner (assuming 0, 0) of the rectangle. Width and height may be positive or negative. The border of the rectangle is drawn using the active Pen color.

declared_variant.name: X
declared_variant.interpretation: The X coordinate in User Space

declared_variant.name: Y
declared_variant.interpretation: The Y coordinate in User Space

declared_variant.name: Width
declared_variant.interpretation: The width value in User Space

declared_variant.name: Height
declared_variant.interpretation: The height value in User Space

sequence.name: FilledRectangleSeq
sequence.interpretation: The Filled Rectangle command specifies a box drawing. X, Y defines the lower left corner (assuming 0, 0) of the rectangle. Width and height may be positive or negative. The border of the rectangle is drawn using the active Pen color and filled with the active Brush color.

declared_variant.name: X
declared_variant.interpretation: The X coordinate in User Space

declared_variant.name: Y
declared_variant.interpretation: The Y coordinate in User Space

declared_variant.name: Width
declared_variant.interpretation: The width value in User Space

declared_variant.name: Height
declared_variant.interpretation: The height value in User Space

sequence.name: CircleSeq
sequence.interpretation: The Circle command defines a circle drawing. X and Y define the center of the circle. All values are in user coordinate space. The border of the circle is drawn using the active Pen color.

declared_variant.name: X
declared_variant.interpretation: The X coordinate in User Space

declared_variant.name: Y
declared_variant.interpretation: The Y coordinate in User Space

declared_variant.name: Radius
declared_variant.interpretation: The radius of the circle in User Space

sequence.name: FilledCircleSeq
sequence.interpretation: The Filled Circle command defines a circle drawing. The X and Y fields define the center of the circle. The border of the circle is drawn using the active Pen color and filled with the active Brush color.

declared_variant.name: X
declared_variant.interpretation: The X coordinate in User Space

declared_variant.name: Y
declared_variant.interpretation: The Y coordinate in User Space

declared_variant.name: Radius
declared_variant.interpretation: The radius of the circle in User Space

sequence.name: EllipseSeq
sequence.interpretation: The Ellipse command defines an ellipse drawing. X and Y define the bottom left corner of the ellipse and the width and height parameters define the size of the ellipse. The border of the ellipse is drawn using the active Pen color.

declared_variant.name: X
declared_variant.interpretation: The X coordinate in User Space

declared_variant.name: Y
declared_variant.interpretation: The Y coordinate in User Space

declared_variant.name: Width
declared_variant.interpretation: The width of the ellipse in User Space

declared_variant.name: Height
declared_variant.interpretation: The height of the ellipse in User Space

sequence.name: FilledEllipseSeq
sequence.interpretation: The Filled Ellipse command defines an ellipse drawing. X and Y define the center of the circle. The border of the ellipse is drawn using the active Pen color and filled with the active Brush color.

declared_variant.name: X
declared_variant.interpretation: The X coordinate in User Space

declared_variant.name: Y
declared_variant.interpretation: The Y coordinate in User Space

declared_variant.name: Width
declared_variant.interpretation: The width of the ellipse in User Space

declared_variant.name: Height
declared_variant.interpretation: The height of the ellipse in User Space

sequence.name: LineSeq
sequence.interpretation: The Line command allows the user to define two points joined by a line to be drawn in the current Pen color and width.

declared_variant.name: X1
declared_variant.interpretation: The start X coordinate in User Space

declared_variant.name: Y1
declared_variant.interpretation: The start Y coordinate in User Space

declared_variant.name: X2
declared_variant.interpretation: The end X coordinate in User Space

declared_variant.name: Y2
declared_variant.interpretation: The end Y coordinate in User Space

list.name: PolylineList
list.interpretation: Draws a sequence of connected lines defined by arrays of X and Y coordinates. Each pair of (X, Y) coordinates defines a point. The figure shall not close if the first point differs from the last point. The first X, Y pair in the list is the start point. The polyline is drawn in the current Pen color and width.

declared_variant.name: X
declared_variant.interpretation: X coordinate in User Space

declared_variant.name: Y
declared_variant.interpretation: Y coordinate in User Space

list.name: PolygonList
list.interpretation: Draws a sequence of connected lines defined by arrays of X and Y coordinates. Each pair of (X, Y) coordinates defines a point. The figure shall not close if the first point differs from the last point. The first X, Y pair in the list is the start point. The polygon is drawn in the current Pen color and width.

declared_variant.name: X
declared_variant.interpretation: X coordinate in User Space

declared_variant.name: Y
declared_variant.interpretation: Y coordinate in User Space

list.name: FilledPolygonList
list.interpretation: Draws a closed polygon defined by arrays of X and Y coordinates. Each pair of (X, Y) coordinates defines a point. The figure closes automatically by drawing a line connecting the final point to the first point, if those points are different. The first X, Y pair in the list is the start point. The border of the polygon is drawn using the active Pen color and filled with the active Brush color.

declared_variant.name: X
declared_variant.interpretation: X coordinate in User Space

declared_variant.name: Y
declared_variant.interpretation: Y coordinate in User Space

sequence.name: ArcSeq
sequence.interpretation: Draws the outline of a circular or elliptical arc covering the specified rectangle. The resulting arc begins at StartAngle and extends for ArcAngle degrees. Angles are interpreted such that 0 degrees is at the 3 o'clock position. A positive value indicates a counter-clockwise rotation while a negative value indicates a clockwise rotation. The center of the arc is the center of the rectangle whose origin is (X, Y). The polygon is drawn in the current Pen color and width.

declared_variant.name: X
declared_variant.interpretation: The X coordinate in User Space

declared_variant.name: Y
declared_variant.interpretation: The Y coordinate in User Space

declared_variant.name: Width
declared_variant.interpretation: The width of the arc to be drawn in User Space

declared_variant.name: Height
declared_variant.interpretation: The height of the arc to be drawn in User Space

declared_variant.name: StartAngle
declared_variant.interpretation: The beginning angle

declared_variant.name: ArcAngle
declared_variant.interpretation: The angular extent of the arc, relative to the start angle

sequence.name: FilledArcSec
sequence.interpretation: Fills a circular or elliptical arc covering the specified rectangle. The resulting arc begins at StartAngle and extends for ArcAngle degrees. Angles are interpreted such that 0 degrees is at the 3 o'clock position. A positive value indicates a counter-clockwise rotation while a negative value indicates a clockwise rotation. The center of the arc is the center of the rectangle whose origin is (X, Y). The border of the arc is drawn using the active Pen color and filled with the active Brush color.

declared_variant.name: X
declared_variant.interpretation: The X coordinate in User Space

declared_variant.name: Y
declared_variant.interpretation: The Y coordinate in User Space

declared_variant.name: Width
declared_variant.interpretation: The width of the arc to be drawn in User Space

declared_variant.name: Height
declared_variant.interpretation: The height of the arc to be drawn in User Space

declared_variant.name: StartAngle
declared_variant.interpretation: The beginning angle

declared_variant.name: ArcAngle
declared_variant.interpretation: The angular extent of the arc, relative to the start angle

variant.name: PushVar
variant.interpretation: The Push command increases the stack level of the graphics transformation matrix stack, copying the current top-level matrix. There are no parameters for this definition.

variant.name: PopVar
variant.interpretation: The Pop command decreases the stack level of the graphics transformation matrix stack, removing the current top-level matrix and returning to the transformation defined prior to the previous Push. There are no parameters for this definition.

declared_variant.name: IfVar
declared_variant.interpretation: The If command starts a conditional block. Variable to test for true/false. Non-zero = false

declared_variant.name: ElseIfVar
declared_variant.interpretation: The Else If command starts an alternative conditional block. Variable to test for true/false. Non-zero = false

variant.name: ElseVar
variant.interpretation: The Else command starts a block of definitions for execution if preceding If and Else If statements were false. There are no parameters for this definition.

variant.name: EndIfVar
variant.interpretation: Terminates a conditional block. There are no parameters for this definition.

declared_variant.name: SelectVar
declared_variant.interpretation: Starts a case statement. Reference to value to be evaluated for each Case statement

declared_variant.name: CaseVar
declared_variant.interpretation: Starts a block of conditional commands executed if the specific value of the Case statement matches the current value of the Select statement. The value to be compared to the reference data in the Select statement

variant.name: DefaultVar
variant.interpretation: Starts a block for execution if no other Case statement command blocks were executed within a Select block. There are no parameters for this definition.

variant.name: EndSelectVar
variant.interpretation: The End Select statement terminates a Select block. There are no parameters for this definition.

sequence.name: ImageSeq
sequence.interpretation: The Image statement defines an area where a static image can be displayed. The image shall be scaled to fit within the defined area. X, Y defines the lower left corner (assuming 0, 0) of the image.

declared_variant.name: X
declared_variant.interpretation: The X coordinate in User Space

declared_variant.name: Y
declared_variant.interpretation: The Y coordinate in User Space

declared_variant.name: Width
declared_variant.interpretation: The width of the image to be drawn in User Space

declared_variant.name: Height
declared_variant.interpretation: The height of the image to be drawn in User Space

declared_variant.name: Reference
declared_variant.interpretation: Reference to the data of image to display. Characterize flag will always be set to 1 (reference value)

fixed_field.name: ImageType
fixed_field.interpretation: The encoding type of the image.

message_def.name: ReportDataDefinition
message_def.description: This message is used to allow a remote asset to define the content of data structures transmitted using Report Data messages for use within the Drawing Definition

message_def.name: ReportData
message_def.description: This message is used to pass blocks of data in a pre-determined format to the operator interface for use within the Drawing Definition

fixed_field.name: DataStructureReference
fixed_field.interpretation: Unique reference to the data structure.

message_def.name: ReportPointingDeviceMovement
message_def.description: This message is used to return the coordinates of the pointing device in the Graphics Viewport

fixed_field.name: X
fixed_field.interpretation: The X coordinate in user values

fixed_field.name: Y
fixed_field.interpretation: The Y coordinate in user values

fixed_field.name: Valid
fixed_field.interpretation: Determines if the pointing device is within the Graphics Viewport

value_enum.interpretation: Cursor is outside the graphics viewport
Cursor is within the graphics viewport

message_def.name: ReportPointingDeviceAction
message_def.description: This message is used to return the pointing device coordinates and the state of the button

fixed_field.name: Button
fixed_field.interpretation: Button code. 0=Left, 1=Middle, 2=Right

fixed_field.name: State
fixed_field.interpretation: The state of the button position. 0=Up, 1=Down

fixed_field.name: X
fixed_field.interpretation: The X coordinate in user values

fixed_field.name: Y
fixed_field.interpretation: The Y coordinate in user values

fixed_field.name: Valid
fixed_field.interpretation: Determines if the pointing device is within the Graphics Viewport

value_enum.interpretation: Cursor is outside the graphics viewport
Cursor is within the graphics viewport

message_def.name: ReportKeyboardAction
message_def.description: This message is used to return keyboard presses

fixed_field.name: Key
fixed_field.interpretation: The 16-Bit Unicode value of the key.

fixed_field.name: KeyState
fixed_field.interpretation: If the key is pressed this value is set to 1. If the key is subsequently released this value is set to 0.

message_def.name: ReportDCM
message_def.description: This message is used to return digital control presses

fixed_field.name: DCMReference
fixed_field.interpretation: Unique reference to the digital control.

fixed_field.name: DCMStateCode
fixed_field.interpretation: Bit 0 set for down or pressed, bit clear for up or released.

message_def.name: ReportAnalogDevices
message_def.description: This message is used to return a list of analog control devices on the operator interface

fixed_field.name: Reference
fixed_field.interpretation: Unique reference to the analog device

variable_length_string.name: Name
variable_length_string.interpretation: Textural identifier for the analog device in a null terminated ASCII String

message_def.name: ReportAnalogAction
message_def.description: This message is used to provide the receiver the current deflection of an analog device.

fixed_field.name: Reference
fixed_field.interpretation: Unique reference to the analog device

variable_field.name: Pitch
variable_field.interpretation: The pitch demand. Positive nose up.

variable_field.name: Yaw
variable_field.interpretation: The yaw demand. Positive nose right.
